etymology.description: semantic: 酉(酉) (yǒu, "wine jar") + phonetic: 卆(卆) (zú, "graduation", phonetic) = related to alcohol -> intoxicated
etymology.interpretation: 醉(醉) (zuì, "drunk") combines the wine jar 酉(酉) (yǒu, "wine jar") indicating the character's association with alcoholic beverages, and 卆(卆) (zú) for its phonetic contribution. This signifies a state induced by consuming wine or alcohol.

examples.chinese: 他昨晚喝醉了(他昨晚喝醉了)。
宴会进行时(宴會進行時)，他已经醉得说不出话来(他已經醉得說不出話來)。
examples.pinyin: Yànhuì jìnxíng shí, tā yǐjīng zuì dé shuō bù chū huà lái.
examples.english: During the banquet, he was so drunk that he couldn’t speak.

examples.chinese: 那个歌手表演时(那個歌手表演時)，一边唱歌一边似乎醉了(一邊唱歌一邊似乎醉了)。
examples.pinyin: Nàgè gēshǒu biǎoyǎn shí, yībiān chànggē yībiān sìhū zuì le.
examples.english: The singer, while performing, seemed intoxicated as he sang.
